title: RADS HTTP Error/Unable To Download League and DNS Change & IPConfig/Flush Does NOT Work.....
body:
I am super frustrated at the fact that I was unable to load the client due to the RADS HTTP Error that most people were/are having. I'm sick and tired of people telling me to utilize Google's DNS servers because I've already done this way before this was posted by Riot. This clearly doesn't work for me even after an ipconfig/flushdns. So....I went ahead and uninstalled League. I wanted to try and see if re-installing League would be a solution. Unfortunately, I can't find out because the League site doesn't work for me at all; it comes up as a blank page. 

Riot, what's the solution here?

replies.body:
Hey all,

If you have confirmed that you have [switched to a public DNS and properly flushed your DNS](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/kurM3m1i-riot-admins-i-got-a-good-one-for-you-i-can-not-play-download-or-view-any-part-of-the-support-pg?comment=0002), and still consistently get RADS errors and can't access the League of Legends site, I want you to try [temporarily using a VPN](https://www.wtfast.com/).  

If this allows you to access the website, or even patch, then we know that the issue is found locally on the connection.  If it is still giving the same errors, then we know we can start looking elsewhere.

If your still seeing these issues, make sure to reply back with what ISP you are using as well.

I can open the client but when I try to log in I get an error message saying that the log in server is not responding. It tries to connect 3 times, then a different window pops up telling me to check if the servers are up, which they are.

I have tried changing my DNS, flushing it, and WTFast isn't working for me (when I try to activate it, it tells me there was a problem with the underlying connection, probably related to my issue).

I am using a wired connection through TWC.

If your consistently getting a Login error, it could be due to an underlying connection issue, or certificate issues.  Try all of the steps in this [Knowledge Base Article](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761944-Login-Issues).  There are a lot, but make sure you try every one!

well wtfast dosent work on mac, n im usin a macbook pro n for mac users we ccant even renistall the game s the download the game as we cannot even access to the download LoL webpage n yeap i hve tried dns flush so i just guess ill wait hope u guys fix it soon!

Dude!!! Im having the exact same problem. Just keep gettin Rads error. Been like that for 3 days now. Ive tried all the recommended solutions, but nothing works.  I cant even load RIOTS support page, or redownload the game.  Who is your isp? Mine is windstream.

I have windstream and i did 2 things to fix it.

First:

Go to control panel
Click Network & Internet
Click internet Options
Click on the connections tab
Click on LAN Settings
At the bottom in the Proxy server
**THESE NEXT FEW STEPS ARE VERY IMPORTANT**
Check-mark Use a proxy server for your LAN (These settings will not apply to                    __________________________________dial-up or VPN connections).
Check-mark Bypass proxy server for local addresses
**NOW**
un-check-mark Use a proxy server for your LAN (These settings will not apply to                    __________________________________dial-up or VPN connections).
and click OK
Click OK
Open it back up and the **Bypass proxy server for local addresses should be** _______________________________Checked still
Close everything and restart your computer



Second:

Perhaps the Network reset?
I had help with my problem I will try to help you.
If this does not help you perhaps it will help others.
I had the rads error and this is what I did to solve it, but I also couldn't connect to anything dealing with league support nor could I re-download the game.
The bold part is the last thing you do, but it is there because that is what a Player Support Specialist named dArtagnan said that most forget to do.

If this does not help you say so and i will try to assist you more, Or you might have better help than me before I can help you.

These steps usually resolve these issues. However, some players do not complete the final step of flushing their DNS. This step is crucial as it
will make sure that your computer uses the new DNS addresses instead of the old ones. For Windows users, make sure that you complete 
these steps after changing the DNS:

Close all open web browsers and applications
Press Win+R to open the Run menu
Type "cmd" and press Enter to open the Command Prompt window
Type “ipconfig /flushdns” and press Enter.
Restart your computer

Windows OS Instructions:

WINDOWS 8

Hit the Windows Key
Type "Control Panel"
Select "Network and Internet"
Select "Network and Sharing Center"
Select "Change Adapter Settings" on the navigation bar on the left
Right click on your network adapter and select "Properties"
Select "Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP/IPv4)" and open "Properties"
Go to the bottom of the menu and change "Obtain DNS server address automatically," to "Use the following DNS server addresses:"
Put in the following public DNS servers, one in each empty field:
8.8.8.8
8.8.4.4
Save your changes by selecting "Ok"
Close all open web browsers and applications
Hit the Windows Key
Right click anywhere
Click on "All Apps"
Right click "Command Prompt" and run as administrator
Type ipconfig /flushdns and press Enter.
Restart your computer

WINDOWS 7

Open the Start Menu
Open Control Panel
Select "Network and Internet"
Select "Network and Sharing Center"
Select "Change Adapter Settings" on the navigation bar on the left
Right click on your network adapter and select "Properties"
Select "Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP/IPv4)" and open Properties
Go to the bottom of the menu and change 'Obtain DNS server address automatically,' to 'Use the following DNS server addresses:'
Put in the following public DNS servers, one in each empty field:
8.8.8.8
8.8.4.4
Save your changes by selecting "Ok"
Close all open web browsers and applications
Press the Windows Key
In the Search bar type command prompt
Right click on the result and select Run as Administrator
In the command prompt type ipconfig /flushdns and press Enter.
Restart your computer

WINDOWS XP

Open the Start Menu
Open Control Panel
Open Network Connections
Right click on your network adapter and select "Properties"
Select "Internet Protocol (TCP/IP)" and open "Properties"
Go to the bottom of the menu and change "Obtain DNS server address automatically,"to "Use the following DNS server addresses:"
Put in the following public DNS servers, one in each empty field:
8.8.8.8
8.8.4.4
Save your changes by selecting "Ok"
Close all open web browsers and applications
Press the Windows Key
In the Search bar type command prompt
Right click on the result and select Run as Administrator
In the command prompt type ipconfig /flushdns and press Enter.
Restart your computer
Mac OS X Instructions:
Open System Preferences
Open the Network preference pane
Select the active connection on the left, and click the "Advanced..." button in the lower right hand corner
Click "DNS" from the selection bar.
Remove any current DNS entries, and input the following public DNS servers:
8.8.8.8
8.8.4.4
Save your changes by selecting "OK"
Apply the changes by clicking "Apply" in the lower right hand corner
Ugh.  Mine is windstream too.  They suck.
My problem is exactly the same as yours and I have Windstream as well. I can't load riots support page or redownload the game and mine has been going one for 3 days also C_C

Hey everyone! Thanks for coming to the Help and Support board! 

Sorry to hear you're all having trouble with this, even after switching to a public DNS and flushing your connection. If you've got a cached version of a Web page saved in your browser history, your browser may be loading that instead of pinging the server for the newest version of the page. Try clearing your browser's cache and see if you can download the game again.

> [{quoted}](name=Elduris,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=qwAFWXK2,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2015-01-13T16:02:11.079+0000)
>
> Hey everyone! Thanks for coming to the Help and Support board! 
> 
> Sorry to hear you're all having trouble with this, even after switching to a public DNS and flushing your connection. If you've got a cached version of a Web page saved in your browser history, your browser may be loading that instead of pinging the server for the newest version of the page. Try clearing your browser's cache and see if you can download the game again.

I deleted all browsing history all cached items and everything else, but that still will not let me get to the download page.
Have you [opened a ticket with Player Support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) yet? If not, please go ahead and do so.

Yeah none of the HTTP CONNECTION Server things I've looked up help me. Apparently I just need something called "lol.launcher.exe" which is not in my folder. Please send me a link to where I can download that to be able to play league again

My wife and I were having same problem for 5 days just found fix that worked for me hope it works for y'all .
1.Hit the Windows Key
2.Type "Control Panel"
3.Select "Network and Internet" 
4.Select "Network and Sharing Center"
5.Select "Change Adapter Settings" on the navigation bar on the left
6.Right click on your network adapter and select "Properties"
7.Select "Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP/IPv4)" and open "Properties"
8.Go to the bottom of the menu and change "Obtain DNS server address automatically." to "Use the following DNS server addresses:"

9.Put in the following public DNS servers, one in each empty field:
> 8.8.8.8
8.8.4.4


10.Save your changes by selecting "OK"
At this point I wonder if they are even trying to fix it.
